column5: I could only dream  :closedeyes:
Florida, Texas, California, family in all of them, big bass too!
What would be you dream ice fishing trip? Expalin why. Damn, I sound like a teacher.  Daniel OCH
Kesagami with Drew for those monster pike and plentiful walleye!
what ben said!

Probly going to northern quebec or labrador,and go ice fishing for HUGE BROOKIES..!!!!  and maybe lake nipigon,  in one of those ice bungalows fishing for HUGE LAKE TROUT..!!! i think both of those trips would be amazing,oh and amybe great bear lake,too,i watched a fishing show and thats what they were doing ,and they caught a 6.5lb brookie through the ice  ,and tons of other ones as well,and we all know how big those lakers get so i think that would be incredible to pull a 30-50lb laker out of a big hole in the ice,!!!!  man im getting depressed already i better stop.....
When's the plane leave?.. or do we gotta take the train?
you tell us Wayne, you're the pilot!
Be a long cold flight...but would be an adventure fishin along the way (till we ran out of fuel anyhow!) LOL
~~~~12" of black ice with 2" of snow on any lake I phish and no SLUSH
4 or 5 playboy girls in sexy lingerie!  Opps sorry wrong dream  CHeers!
What Ben, Raf and Wayne said.
LOL...I have to agree though...monster pike fishing with bunk would be up there on my list!  Got extra room for a small hobbitt????
I'd do it again in a heart beat! Definately a dream trip.

My dream ice fishing trip would be to do one ive already done. Seven days up at Temagami. Bunch of buddies. Seven different lakes. Caught every species available. Lakers, Whitefish, Herring, Walleye, Pike, Brook Trout and Ling. It was a new adventure everyday and was the best ice fishing trip Ive ever done.

When I lived up in Attawapiskat, at freeze up, as soon as skidoos could cross the rivers and muskeg safely, people would go into Hawley Lake for a few days and catch hundreds of lake trout.  The fish caught were selectively harvested in the 5-10 lb range because that size was perfect for smoking... smaller and larger going back.  The odd pike and eye I imagine were caught too.  I'd love to make that trip with my brother-in-law Joe.  Take our Bravo's and haul sleds.  Set up the prospector and stay a few days.
my dream ice fishing trip would envolve me flying south to fish for peacock bass where its warm like mexico.
Dang fishtat beat me to it  Maureen
besides Kesagami with drew...   a week on Lake of the Woods
Abitibi, remote, big pike and lots of tasty walleye.
been there done that its an amazing fisherie u forgot one thing  mooneyes and ling are plentiful
also would be lake of the woods, haerd and seen lots of good fishing thier.

LOTW for sure and also maybe Great Slave for monster lakers.... also would be nice to Hit Nipigon or another Speck lake... Fortunately I may be moving near Nipigon and within a few hrs drive of LOTW so my wishes may well come true
My DREAM ice fishing trip involves all the ice melting, and me happening to have a boat handy...
Like others said , icefishing with moosebunk on any lake in his area would be at the top of the list.Really any lake with monster pike would be cool.
Monster pike or lakers up north, or muskies (where legal of course)

We've done my dream for the last 3 years now. Lake Nip and the "on ice bungalows"  I know there are far more exotic places to go.  But you get all 6 of us in the same bungalow, 3 guitars, a drum set made from tupperwear bowls or whatever else we can find, my mandolin (just learning) and we rock the joint lol, to our ears anyway.  Add Walleye, Pike, Herring and big Whities.  BBQ'd chickens at 3 a.m. and more booze than most liquor stores carry. Fresh Walleye for breakfast. And I can stay in bed and keep fishing - perfect for the nastier hangovers.  The smiles last for weeks afterwards.  I'm pretty sure it's considered my dream location more for the friends and good times than it is for the fishing. I swing back the other way when the ice melts....to a point...   Hookset.
